title: How to add music to a YouTube video - Quora

response.answer_text: Edit videos and add soundtracks After you’ve finished recording your video clips on YouTube Capture, tap the Edit and upload icon    in the top right corner. Or, you can tap the Video Manager icon    to see all videos. Trim clips and videos Change the start and end points of your clips by dragging the handles. If you're creating a multiclip video, tap the clip’s thumbnail at the bottom of the screen to trim it. Reorder, remove, and add clips Reorder clips: Once you’re in the editing screen, reorder your video clips by pressing and holding them. Drag and drop your clips to rearrange them.Remove clips: Tap the clip you want to remove, then Remove clip at to the top of the screen. This will remove the clip from your video project, but won't delete the original recording.Add clips: Tap the + icon at the bottom of the screen to record a new clip or add an existing one.Add music Add background music to your video by tapping Add music at the top of the editing screen. Select Music From Device: Upload a music track that’s stored on your iOS device. Learn more about using music in your YouTube videos.YouTube Soundtrack: Choose a song from an existing track list, available for free.Once you’ve added music, change the volume by tapping the Music banner at the top of the editing screen. Use the volume slider to change the mix level of the music track. When sliding the music volume all the way to the right, the music will replace the recorded audio completely. Title, description, tags, and other metadata You can add a title for your video on the uploading screen (tap the right arrow at the top of the editing page to upload your video). You can only add a description, tags, and other metadata after you’ve uploaded your video. To do so, go to the Video Manager, then tap on the video you’d like to edit. Add video enhancements Add enhancements to your videos by tapping the … icon on the upload screen. Color correction - Color correction boosts the colors of your video.Stabilization - Stabilization reduces the shakiness of your video.According to Edit videos and add soundtrack

You can add music from YouTube's own library. They have done a pretty good job at listing down all possible genre's of music with royalty free music. What that means is you can upload your videos and then select the music that suits the video, then add it as an overlay to the video. There are no copyright infringements here. The only catch is that not all music is awesome, they are more like fillers and background music and you will need to listen to a whole lot of music from their library to choose the right one that suits your video's mood. Another one problem I found is that sometimes the music's timing does not match the videos. For example, the video might be 10 minute long but the music only 6 minutes. Then you have to either loop in the music or fade it out at 6 minutes. Same thing for long videos. Finding long music for long videos is kind of tricky. There is a neat work around though - http://news.manikarthik.com/long-music-videos/technology/how-to/. (Disclaimer - I wrote this blog article.) Hope you find it useful.
